conversation_id: "68aeb431-734c-8332-937e-015c994ef5a9" title: "Codex update overview" accounts: ["Account1_exports"] models: [] tags: [] message_count: 50

Codex update overview

system

user

2025-08-27T07:31:06.421134Z user

Uh oh look at this

Logo ChatGPT Team Update

Hello,

On Wednesday, were launching an update to Codex with a new IDE extension, Sign in with ChatGPT, upgraded CLI and code review in Github.

Whats New

IDE Extension: Interactive UI that embeds Codex directly in developer workflows Sign in with ChatGPT: Available in both the IDE and CLI, eliminating API key setup and providing access directly through your existing ChatGPT plan Seamless Local Cloud Handoff: Developers can pair with Codex locally and then delegate tasks to the cloud to execute asynchronously without losing state Upgraded Codex CLI: Refreshed UI, new commands, and bug fixes Code reviews in GitHub: Set up Codex to automatically review new PRs in a repo, or mention @codex in PRs to get reviews and suggested fixes Next Steps for Admins

Enable Codex in settings Encourage your developers to: Download or update the Codex CLI and sign in with ChatGPT Try the new IDE extension to pair program locally Delegate tasks to Codex in the cloud Enable Code Review for their PRs Pricing

Codex is now included with your ChatGPT subscription - no extra license required. To access Codex, enable it in your settings.

The OpenAI Team

2025 OpenAI. All Rights Reserved. 1455 3rd Street, San Francisco, California 94158, United States Unsubscribe

2025-08-27T07:31:06.485906Z assistant

2025-08-27T07:31:06.498655Z assistant

Whoa that looks like a product update email from OpenAI about Codex 2.0 being folded directly into ChatGPT subscriptions.

A few big takeaways from what you pasted:

  • IDE Extension Codex will live inside developer tools (like VS Code), making it a native pair-programmer rather than copy/paste from the chat window.
  • Sign in with ChatGPT Instead of juggling API keys, youll just log in with your ChatGPT account and carry your plan/entitlements across CLI, IDE, and GitHub.
  • Seamless local cloud handoff You can do work on your laptop and then punt heavy tasks (big refactors, test runs, async jobs) to the cloud without losing session context.
  • Upgraded CLI New commands + bug fixes + same ChatGPT login.
  • GitHub PR reviews You can @codex in a pull request and get inline suggestions + fixes.

The kicker: no extra license its bundled with your existing ChatGPT plan once you enable it in settings.

That basically means OpenAI is collapsing ChatGPT + Codex into one dev-focused ecosystem, competing directly with GitHub Copilot X but with tighter integration into your ChatGPT sessions.

Want me to break down step-by-step how you can get this enabled on your machine once it rolls out Wednesday (CLI, IDE, GitHub integration)?

2025-08-27T07:32:01.389181Z user

Neat

2025-08-27T07:32:01.510256Z assistant

Right? Its basically like theyre giving everyone a built-in AI dev assistant that can live in chat, your terminal, your editor, and your repo reviews all at once. No more juggling logins or contexts.

Would you like me to map out how this could slot into your EverLight OS / AWS / Amazon workflow? Feels like it could supercharge the council idea you were sketching with Codex/Q.

2025-08-27T07:33:01.117926Z user

So q developer already works inside vscode so anyway by the time I get back to stable ground again we'll have all the tools necessary to streamline our building of the EverLight OS

2025-08-27T07:33:01.293331Z assistant

Exactly Q already being able to live inside VS Code means youve laid the groundwork. Once this Codex+ChatGPT rollout stabilizes, youll basically have:

  • Q in VS Code your local dev partner, already wired into EverLight OS.
  • Codex extension the bridge between Q and ChatGPT, letting you hand work off to cloud Codex without losing continuity.
  • CLI + GitHub review hooks a tight loop between writing, testing, and publishing code.

That means EverLight OS development could move from fragmented (local vs. chat vs. cloud vs. repo) to a seamless continuum where youre never really leaving the council chamber.
